title: Gwyneth Paltrow explains gaffe where she FORGOT that she featured in Spiderman
text:
She famously forgot that she had appeared in Spiderman: Homecoming.

And now Gwyneth Paltrow has explained her gaffe by saying there are 'so many' Marvel films and being a mum means that she lost track.

The Seven star, 47, had a brief cameo role in the 2017 film and has also starred as Pepper Potts in six other Marvel films, yet earlier this year it became apparent this accolade on her CV had gone unnoticed.

Brain freeze: Gwyneth Paltrow explained the awkward moment when she forgot she featured in Spiderman: Homecoming by saying there are 'so many' Marvel films that she lost track

She revealed that she had 'forgotten' her Spiderman role during a guest appearance on Jon Favreau's The Chef Show back in June, where Jon started to reminisce about their time filming the action movie.

'We're weren't in Spider-Man,' Gwyneth said. 'No, I was in Avengers. What?'

Favreau replied: 'Remember, Spider-Man at the end, and Tom Holland's there and you're going to walk out and do a press conference? I give you the ring?'

Once it hit her, she exclaimed, 'Oh yes! That was Spider-Man? Oh my god!'

Woah! The Seven star, 47, had a brief cameo role (pictured above) in the 2017 film and has also starred as Pepper Potts in six other Marvel films

But now the star explained she was 'confused' by the number of Marvel films she had been in.

She has starred in all three Iron Man films, as well as The Avengers, Avengers: Infinity War and Avengers: Endgame.

Gwyneth told Elle magazine: 'I never read stuff. But it is confusing because there are so many Marvel movies, and to be honest, I haven't seen very many of them.'

'I thought that it was an Avengers movie': Gwyneth Paltrow explained why she forgot about appearing in Spider-Man: Homecoming

'It’s really stupid and I’m sorry, but I’m a 47-year-old mother,' she added.

Gwyneth has two children, Apple and Moses, with her ex-husband Chris Martin, the front man of Coldplay.

The couple divorced in 2016 and the Iron Man star re-married in 2018 when she tied the knot with director Brad Falchuk.

The saga continued during an appearance on Jimmy Kimmel Live last week the star said the gaffe was 'so embarrassing' when Kimmel brought it up.

'I just got confused!' she insisted. 'There's so many of these wonderful Marvel interconnecting movies, and I thought that it was an Avengers movie, but it was not.'

Don't remind her! Paltrow buried her face in her hands as Jimmy asked her about the awkward moment

'Was Spider-Man himself offended by this?' Jimmy asked, referring to Tom Holland.

Embarrassingly, Gwyneth once again admitted she had never even seen the movie.

'I never actually saw the movie,' she said, before backtracking. 'I mean wait, cut that out!'

It comes after the Goop founder joined Paris Jackson at the amFAR Gala in Los Angeles.

Meet n greet: The Goop founder recently joined Paris Jackson at the amFAR Gala in Los Angeles

Both wore long gowns as they took their time on the purple carpet saying hello and posing side-by-side. Both stars come from famous families.

Gwyneth's mother is the respected actress Blythe Danner, 76, who has lit up I'll See You In My Dreams and Meet The Fockers. She also appeared on Will & Grace for several years.

Paltrow's father is the late Bruce Paltrow who was behind the TV series St Elsewhere, while Paris' father is the late King Of Pop Michael Jackson.
description: Gwyneth Paltrow has explained her gaffe by saying there are 'so many' Marvel films that she lost track. The Seven star, 47, had a brief cameo role in the 2017 film.
